[et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ admin_label=”Banner” module_class=”torn-edge” _builder_version=”4.9.6″ _module_preset=”default” use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_start=”rgba(223,217,191,0.76)” background_color_gradient_end=”rgba(0,0,0,0)” background_color_gradient_overlays_image=”on” background_image=”http://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/porn-and-sex-banner.jpg” min_height=”48vh” custom_margin=”||||false|false” custom_padding=”||65px|||”][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.4″ background_enable_color=”off” use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_start=”#ffffff” background_color_gradient_end=”#efefef” background_color_gradient_end_position=”4%” custom_margin=”|||” custom_padding=”0|0px|54px|0px|false|false”][et_pb_row disabled_on=”on|off|off” module_class=” et_pb_row_fullwidth” _builder_version=”3.25″ width=”89%” width_tablet=”80%” width_phone=”” width_last_edited=”on|desktop” max_width=”89%” max_width_tablet=”80%” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” custom_padding=”0|0px|0|0px|false|false” make_fullwidth=”on”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_divider show_divider=”off” _builder_version=”3.15″ max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” height=”10px”]

 

[/et_pb_divider][et_pb_divider show_divider=”off” _builder_version=”3.15″ max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” height=”10px”]

 

[/et_pb_divider][et_pb_divider show_divider=”off” _builder_version=”3.15″ max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” height=”10px”]

 

[/et_pb_divider][et_pb_image src=”/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/GSVSPS.svg” align_tablet=”center” align_phone=”” align_last_edited=”on|desktop” module_class=”GSVSPS” _builder_version=”3.23″ max_width=”77%” max_width_tablet=”100%” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|tablet” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”-12%|||” custom_margin_tablet=”-15%|||” custom_margin_phone=”|||” custom_margin_last_edited=”on|phone”]

 

[/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”3_4,1_4″ _builder_version=”4.9.4″ max_width=”1013px”][et_pb_column type=”3_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Intro Title” _builder_version=”4.9.4″ text_font=”||||||||” header_font=”||||||||” header_text_color=”#222222″ header_font_size=”70px” header_2_font=”|300|||||||” header_6_font=”||||||||”]

So what’s the difference between great sex and porn sex?

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text admin_label=”Intro Quote” _builder_version=”4.9.10″ text_font=”|300|||||||” text_font_size=”24px” text_line_height=”30px” hover_enabled=”0″ sticky_enabled=”0″]We all want great sex and we know that consent, emotional connection, pleasure and feeling safe are a key part of this. So how do they compare…?[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text module_class=”col-quote-block” _builder_version=”4.9.6″ _module_preset=”default”]

“I definitely think it’s a good thing realising that sex and real life is different from porn – you kinda get this sense of freedom.”
—NZ male, 20 yrs (47)

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.9.4″ custom_padding=”27px|0px|0|0px|false|false” custom_css_before=”width: 150px;||height: 1298px;||content: ”;||background-image: url(/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/great-sex-doodle.png);||position: absolute;||right: -170px;||top: -6px;||background-size: cover;”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Intro Text” _builder_version=”4.9.4″ header_font=”||||||||” header_text_color=”#ffffff” header_2_font=”|300|||||||” header_2_text_color=”#bf9a46″ header_2_font_size=”36px” header_4_font=”||||||||” header_4_text_color=”#ffffff” header_4_font_size=”19px” background_color=”#4b858e” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”220px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”|||” custom_padding=”15px|15px|2px|15px|false|true”]

GOT CONSENT?

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_2,1_2″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”0″ disabled_on=”on|on|off” _builder_version=”3.25″ max_width=”80%” use_custom_width=”on” width_unit=”off”][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][dsm_flipbox flipbox_effect=”up” flipbox_speed=”1s” flipbox_height=”365px” _builder_version=”4.9.7″ max_width=”506px” module_alignment=”right”][dsm_flipbox_child image_max_width=”34%” button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.7″ header_level=”h4″ header_font=”||||||||” header_text_align=”center” header_font_size=”1px” content_font=”||||||||” content_text_color=”#000000″ subhead_font=”||||||||” background_image=”https://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Great-Sex-1.png” background_size=”contain” text_orientation=”center” custom_padding=”48px|30px|48px|30px|true|true”]

SOOO YES!

You may think… great, here comes another consent speech. But seriously, beyond #metoo, saying “yes” is an important part of great sex, and it’s actually the law.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][dsm_flipbox_child title=”Consent means…” button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.7″ header_level=”h4″ header_font=”||||||||” header_font_size=”25px” content_font=”||||||||” content_font_size=”19px” content_line_height=”1.3em” background_color=”#bf9a46″ text_orientation=”center” background_layout=”dark” custom_padding=”20px|20px|20px|20px|true|true”]

…your partner is all good with every part of sex – you don’t need to worry, you’re safe, and knowing your partner is into it makes it so much better for you both.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][/dsm_flipbox][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][dsm_flipbox flipbox_effect=”up” flipbox_speed=”1s” flipbox_height=”365px” _builder_version=”4.9.7″ max_width=”506px” module_alignment=”left”][dsm_flipbox_child image_max_width=”34%” button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.7″ header_level=”h4″ header_font=”||||||||” header_text_align=”center” header_font_size=”1px” content_font=”||||||||” content_text_color=”#ffffff” subhead_font=”||||||||” background_image=”https://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Porn-Sex.png” background_size=”contain” text_orientation=”center” background_layout=”dark” custom_padding=”48px|30px|48px|30px|true|true”]

YEAH… NAH

You prob don’t need to be told “porn is not real kids” but we’re going to tell you anyway, because this is important. Porn is not real kids.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][dsm_flipbox_child title=”It’s all an act” button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.7″ header_font=”||||||||” header_font_size=”25px” content_font=”||||||||” content_font_size=”18px” content_line_height=”1.3em” background_color=”#4b858e” text_orientation=”center” background_layout=”dark” custom_padding=”20px|20px|20px|20px|true|true”]

Porn sex is performed by actors and there isn’t much “yes” or consent at all in porn sex. In fact, heaps of porn makes pressuring someone into sex or lack-of consent look sexy – and then actors act their enjoyment. This gives pretty messed up messages about consent and how important it is for great sex. It’s pretty easy to understand consent – if someone’s not fully into it saying “yes”, it’s a no.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][/dsm_flipbox][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_2,1_2″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”1″ disabled_on=”off|off|on” _builder_version=”3.25″][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_toggle title=”SOOO YES!” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” _builder_version=”4.9.4″ title_text_color=”#000000″ title_level=”h4″ title_font=”||||||||” title_font_size=”36px” background_image=”https://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Great-Sex-1.png” background_position=”center_right” text_orientation=”center” custom_padding=”152px||152px||true” border_width_all=”0px”]

You may think… great, here comes another consent speech. But seriously, beyond #metoo, saying “yes” is an important part of great sex, and it’s actually the law. 

Consent means your partner is all good with everything – you don’t need to worry, you’re safe, and knowing your partner is into it makes it so much better for you both.

[/et_pb_toggle][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_toggle title=”YEAH… NAH” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” _builder_version=”3.17.6″ title_text_color=”#ffffff” title_level=”h4″ title_font=”||||||||” title_font_size=”36px” body_font=”||||||||” body_text_color=”#ffffff” background_image=”https://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Porn-Sex.png” background_position=”center_right” text_orientation=”center” custom_padding=”152px||152px||true” border_width_all=”0px”]

It’s not like you have to be told “porn is not real kids” but we’re going to tell you anyway, because this is important. Porn is not real kids.

It’s all an act! Porn sex is performed by actors and there isn’t much “yes” or consent at all in porn sex. In fact, heaps of porn makes pressuring someone into sex or lack-of consent look sexy – and then actors act their enjoyment. This gives pretty messed up messages about consent and how important it is for great sex. It’s pretty easy to understand consent – if it’s not yes, it’s no.

[/et_pb_toggle][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”3.25″ background_color_gradient_direction=”90deg” custom_padding=”27px|0px|0|0px|false|false”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Intro Text” _builder_version=”4.9.4″ header_font=”||||||||” header_2_font=”|300|||||||” header_2_text_color=”#bf9a46″ header_2_font_size=”36px” header_4_font=”||||||||” header_4_text_color=”#ffffff” header_4_font_size=”19px” background_color=”#4b858e” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”320px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”|||” custom_padding=”15px|15px|2px|15px|false|true”]

EMOTIONAL CONNECTION?

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_2,1_2″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”0″ disabled_on=”on|on|off” _builder_version=”3.25″][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][dsm_flipbox flipbox_effect=”up” flipbox_speed=”1s” flipbox_height=”365px” _builder_version=”4.9.7″ max_width=”506px” module_alignment=”right”][dsm_flipbox_child image_max_width=”34%” button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.7″ header_level=”h4″ header_font=”||||||||” header_text_align=”center” header_font_size=”1px” content_font=”||||||||” content_text_color=”#000000″ subhead_font=”||||||||” background_image=”https://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Great-Sex-1.png” background_size=”contain” text_orientation=”center” custom_padding=”48px|30px|48px|30px|true|true”]

TWO IS BETTER THAN ONE

Yep, trust an emotional connection and liking the other person are important foundations for a good time.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][dsm_flipbox_child title=”When you’re connected, sex is way more likely to be awesome…” button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.7″ header_font=”||||||||” header_font_size=”25px” content_font=”||||||||” content_font_size=”18px” content_line_height=”1.3em” background_color=”#bf9a46″ text_orientation=”center” background_layout=”dark” custom_padding=”20px|20px|20px|20px|true|true”]

you can say what you like or don’t like, there’s no pressure to act or look a certain way, and you can both feel comfortable.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][/dsm_flipbox][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][dsm_flipbox flipbox_effect=”up” flipbox_speed=”1s” flipbox_height=”365px” _builder_version=”4.9.7″ max_width=”506px” module_alignment=”left”][dsm_flipbox_child image_max_width=”34%” button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.7″ header_level=”h4″ header_font=”||||||||” header_text_align=”center” header_font_size=”1px” content_font=”||||||||” content_text_color=”#ffffff” subhead_font=”||||||||” background_image=”https://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Porn-Sex.png” background_size=”contain” text_orientation=”center” background_layout=”dark” custom_padding=”48px|30px|48px|30px|true|true”]

THE SCREEN’S YOUR LOVER

With porn, it’s just a ‘me, myself and I’ situation. It’s just a physical thing – it’s a spectator sport, there’s no emotional connection.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][dsm_flipbox_child title=”NOT THE REAL DEAL…” button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.7″ header_font=”||||||||” header_font_size=”25px” content_font=”||||||||” content_font_size=”18px” content_line_height=”1.3em” background_color=”#4b858e” text_orientation=”center” background_layout=”dark” custom_padding=”20px|20px|20px|20px|true|true”]

Porn might give you a quick fix, but it’s a poor replacement for being emotionally and sexually connected with someone. And the more time you spend focused on your own wants and needs, the harder it can be to be satisfied with a real person.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][/dsm_flipbox][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_2,1_2″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”1″ disabled_on=”off|off|on” _builder_version=”3.25″][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_toggle title=”TWO IS BETTER THAN ONE” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” _builder_version=”3.17.6″ title_text_color=”#000000″ title_level=”h4″ title_font=”||||||||” title_font_size=”36px” title_line_height=”1.1em” background_image=”https://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Great-Sex-1.png” background_position=”center_right” text_orientation=”center” custom_padding=”152px||152px||true” border_width_all=”0px”]

Yep, trust and emotional connection are important foundations for a good time in the bedroom – you’re “feeling the love.”

When you’re connected, sex is way more likely to be awesome… you can say what you like or don’t like, there’s no pressure to act or look a certain way, and you both feel good about it.

[/et_pb_toggle][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_toggle title=”THE SCREEN’S YOUR LOVER” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” _builder_version=”3.17.6″ title_text_color=”#ffffff” title_level=”h4″ title_font=”||||||||” title_font_size=”36px” title_line_height=”1.1em” body_font=”||||||||” body_text_color=”#ffffff” background_image=”https://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Porn-Sex.png” background_position=”center_right” text_orientation=”center” custom_padding=”152px||152px||true” border_width_all=”0px”]

With porn, it’s just a ‘me, myself and I’ situation. Sex is just a physical transaction – it’s a spectator sport, there’s no partner and there’s no emotional connection.

Porn might give you a quick fix, but it’s a poor replacement for being emotionally and sexually connected with someone. And the more time you spend focused on your own wants and needs, the harder it is to be satisfied with a real person.

[/et_pb_toggle][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”3.25″ background_color_gradient_direction=”90deg” custom_padding=”27px|0px|0|0px|false|false”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Intro Text” _builder_version=”4.9.4″ header_font=”||||||||” header_2_font=”|300|||||||” header_2_text_color=”#bf9a46″ header_2_font_size=”36px” header_4_font=”||||||||” header_4_text_color=”#ffffff” header_4_font_size=”19px” background_color=”#4b858e” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”320px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”|||” custom_padding=”15px|15px|2px|15px|false|true”]

PLEASURE?

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_2,1_2″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”1″ disabled_on=”off|off|on” _builder_version=”3.25″][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_toggle title=”HITTING THE HIGHS” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” _builder_version=”3.17.6″ title_text_color=”#000000″ title_level=”h4″ title_font_size=”36px” title_line_height=”1.1em” background_image=”https://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Great-Sex-1.png” background_position=”center_right” text_orientation=”center” custom_padding=”152px||152px||true” border_width_all=”0px”]

Great sex should feel good …

It’s about the sweet spot of giving and receiving pleasure: you care for each other and you can talk about what you want and don’t want. There are realistic expectations – and no one is pressured to do things they aren’t into just for the other partner. The expectation is always that it will feel good for you both.

[/et_pb_toggle][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_toggle title=”JUST PRETENDING” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” _builder_version=”3.17.6″ title_text_color=”#ffffff” title_level=”h4″ title_font=”||||||||” title_font_size=”36px” title_line_height=”1.1em” body_font=”||||||||” body_text_color=”#ffffff” background_image=”https://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Porn-Sex.png” background_position=”center_right” text_orientation=”center” custom_padding=”152px||152px||true” border_width_all=”0px”]

The thing with porn is that the more you watch, the more ‘normal’ you think it is …

Porn shapes expectations from surgically altered bodies, to faked enjoyment and aggressive sex, porn is just not realistic and can lead to disappointment and/or downright failure in the bedroom. Watching lots of porn can end up taking the pleasure out of the real deal – with guys not being able to ‘get it up’ anymore, girls disliking their bodies, feelings of inadequacy compared to what’s on screen and/or trying things that are degrading or painful in real life..

[/et_pb_toggle][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_2,1_2″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”0″ disabled_on=”on|on|off” _builder_version=”3.25″][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][dsm_flipbox flipbox_effect=”up” flipbox_speed=”1s” flipbox_height=”365px” _builder_version=”4.9.7″ max_width=”506px” module_alignment=”right”][dsm_flipbox_child image_max_width=”34%” button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.7″ header_level=”h4″ header_font=”||||||||” header_text_align=”center” header_font_size=”1px” content_font=”||||||||” content_text_color=”#000000″ subhead_font=”||||||||” background_image=”https://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Great-Sex-1.png” background_size=”contain” text_orientation=”center” custom_padding=”48px|30px|48px|30px|true|true”]

HITTING THE HIGHS

Great sex should feel good.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][dsm_flipbox_child title=”IT’S PLEASURABLE FOR BOTH PARTNERS…” button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.7″ header_font=”||||||||” header_font_size=”25px” content_font=”||||||||” content_font_size=”18px” content_line_height=”1.3em” background_color=”#bf9a46″ text_orientation=”center” background_layout=”dark” custom_padding=”20px|20px|20px|20px|true|true”]

because the stars are aligned… you’re with someone you care about, you can talk about what you want, you’re safe, you have realistic expectations, you both consent and there’s heaps of mutual respect.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][/dsm_flipbox][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][dsm_flipbox flipbox_effect=”up” flipbox_speed=”1s” flipbox_height=”365px” _builder_version=”4.9.7″ max_width=”506px” module_alignment=”left”][dsm_flipbox_child image_max_width=”34%” button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.7″ header_level=”h4″ header_font=”||||||||” header_text_align=”center” header_font_size=”1px” content_font=”||||||||” content_text_color=”#ffffff” subhead_font=”||||||||” background_image=”https://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Porn-Sex.png” background_size=”contain” text_orientation=”center” background_layout=”dark” custom_padding=”48px|30px|48px|30px|true|true”]

JUST PRETENDING

The thing with porn is that the more you watch, the more ‘normal’ you think it is…

[/dsm_flipbox_child][dsm_flipbox_child title=”PORN SHAPES EXPECTATIONS…” button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.7″ header_font=”||||||||” header_font_size=”25px” content_font=”||||||||” content_font_size=”18px” content_line_height=”1.3em” background_color=”#4b858e” text_orientation=”center” background_layout=”dark” custom_padding=”20px|20px|20px|20px|true|true”]

The thing with porn is that the more you watch, the more ‘normal’ you think it is… from perfect bodies, to faked enjoyment and aggressive sex, porn shapes our expectations. These things are pretty different to real life sex and can lead to disappointment and/or downright failure.

Watching lots of porn can end up taking the pleasure out of the real deal – whether its not being able to ‘get it up’ anymore, disliking your body, feelings of inadequacy compared to what’s on screen and/or trying things that are degrading or painful in real life.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][/dsm_flipbox][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”3.25″ background_color_gradient_direction=”90deg” custom_padding=”27px|0px|0|0px|false|false”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Intro Text” _builder_version=”4.9.4″ header_font=”||||||||” header_2_font=”|300|||||||” header_2_text_color=”#bf9a46″ header_2_font_size=”36px” header_4_font=”||||||||” header_4_text_color=”#ffffff” header_4_font_size=”19px” background_color=”#4b858e” text_orientation=”center” max_width=”320px” module_alignment=”center” custom_margin=”|||” custom_padding=”15px|15px|2px|15px|false|true”]

SAFE?

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_2,1_2″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”1″ disabled_on=”off|off|on” _builder_version=”3.25″][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_toggle title=”NO WORRIES” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” _builder_version=”3.17.6″ title_text_color=”#000000″ title_level=”h4″ title_font=”||||||||” title_font_size=”36px” title_line_height=”1.1em” background_image=”https://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Great-Sex-1.png” background_position=”center_right” text_orientation=”center” custom_padding=”152px||152px||true” border_width_all=”0px”]

Safe sex means you make your own decisions, you’re listened to and you can say stop at any point – even if your partner is really into it.

GREAT SEX IS ALWAYS SAFE; PHYSICALLY AND EMOTIONALLY…
You’re physically comfortable; you can talk about using contraception; and you can feel good about the type of sex you are having, with no lingering worries or regret afterwards. You feel emotionally respected and your partner makes you feel good about your gender, sexuality and culture.

[/et_pb_toggle][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_toggle title=”STRAIGHT UP DODGY” open_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” closed_toggle_background_color=”#ffffff” _builder_version=”3.17.6″ title_text_color=”#ffffff” title_level=”h4″ title_font=”||||||||” title_font_size=”36px” title_line_height=”1.1em” body_font=”||||||||” body_text_color=”#ffffff” background_image=”https://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Porn-Sex.png” background_position=”center_right” text_orientation=”center” custom_padding=”152px||152px||true” border_width_all=”0px”]

Straight up. Porn sex is often not ‘safe’. Condoms are often not used and a lot of porn is violent, verbally aggressive and degrading.

PORN CAN BE RACIST AND SEXIST
There can be sexism, domination and power imbalances in heterosexual, gay and lesbian porn – and porn actors are paid to look like they are enjoying it, even if it’s painful or degrading. So, you get the message…. lots of porn sex just isn’t that safe. It doesn’t show what people actually like or want – so if you think you’re learning some great sex techniques from porn, it might go downhill when it comes to the real thing.

[/et_pb_toggle][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_2,1_2″ use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”0″ disabled_on=”on|on|off” _builder_version=”3.25″][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][dsm_flipbox flipbox_effect=”up” flipbox_speed=”1s” flipbox_height=”365px” _builder_version=”4.9.7″ max_width=”506px” module_alignment=”right”][dsm_flipbox_child image_max_width=”34%” button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.7″ header_level=”h4″ header_font=”||||||||” header_text_align=”center” header_font_size=”1px” content_font=”||||||||” content_text_color=”#000000″ subhead_font=”||||||||” background_image=”https://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Great-Sex-1.png” background_size=”contain” text_orientation=”center” custom_padding=”48px|30px|48px|30px|true|true”]

NO WORRIES

Great sex is always safe; physically and emotionally…

[/dsm_flipbox_child][dsm_flipbox_child title=”GREAT SEX IS ALWAYS SAFE; PHYSICALLY AND EMOTIONALLY…” button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.7″ header_font=”||||||||” header_font_size=”25px” content_font=”||||||||” content_font_size=”18px” content_line_height=”1.3em” background_color=”#bf9a46″ text_orientation=”center” background_layout=”dark” custom_padding=”20px|20px|20px|20px|true|true”]

Great sex means you make your own decisions, you’re listened to, you’re not worried about getting pregnant or STIs (sexually transmitted infections), you’re physically comfortable, you trust the other person, and there are no lingering worries about what happens ‘after’.

Sex tip: If sex is hurting or feeling uncomfortable then press pause. It’s not good for your body or your relationship.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][/dsm_flipbox][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_2″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][dsm_flipbox flipbox_effect=”up” flipbox_speed=”1s” flipbox_height=”365px” _builder_version=”4.9.7″ max_width=”506px” module_alignment=”left”][dsm_flipbox_child image_max_width=”34%” button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.7″ header_level=”h4″ header_font=”||||||||” header_text_align=”center” header_font_size=”1px” content_font=”||||||||” content_text_color=”#ffffff” subhead_font=”||||||||” background_image=”https://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Porn-Sex.png” background_size=”contain” text_orientation=”center” background_layout=”dark” custom_padding=”48px|30px|48px|30px|true|true”]

STRAIGHT UP DODGY

Straight up. Porn sex is often not ‘safe’. Condoms are hardly ever used and a lot of porn is violent, verbally aggressive and degrading.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][dsm_flipbox_child title=”PORN CAN BE RACIST AND SEXIST” button_url_new_window=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.7″ header_font=”||||||||” header_font_size=”25px” content_font=”||||||||” content_font_size=”18px” content_line_height=”1.3em” background_color=”#4b858e” text_orientation=”center” background_layout=”dark” custom_padding=”20px|20px|20px|20px|true|true”]

There’s TONS of family/”step” sex in porn, which is actually illegal. It can also be racist and reinforce stereotypes – often with one person having all the power in most genres.

Porn actors are paid to just sit back and take it – and to pretend they are enjoying it, even if it’s painful and degrading.

So, you get the message… lots of porn sex just isn’t that safe. Or Legal. It doesn’t show what people actually like or want – so if you think you’re learning some great sex techniques from porn, it might go downhill when it comes to the real thing.

[/dsm_flipbox_child][/dsm_flipbox][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.4″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#efefef”][et_pb_row custom_padding_last_edited=”on|phone” module_class=”footer-quote-block” _builder_version=”4.9.4″ _module_preset=”default” background_color=”#F6F3EF” z_index=”2″ custom_margin=”||-15vh||false|false” custom_padding=”80px|80px|80px|80px|true|true” custom_padding_tablet=”” custom_padding_phone=”|20px|20px|20px|false|true” global_colors_info=”{%22gcid-1b27fc3d-7579-4286-975a-244b5a16c6f4%22:%91%93,%22gcid-a394b62d-6ad6-4a00-840a-6f56a4918f0b%22:%91%93}”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.9.4″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.9.4″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#333333″ text_line_height=”1.9em” text_font_size_tablet=”” text_font_size_phone=”15px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|phone”]

Porn didn’t teach me much, but it did teach me, by not showing it, that there’s like intimacy and emotion that comes up (in real life sex ) like before and afterwards. Porn doesn’t show that.”

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.9.6″ _module_preset=”default” text_text_color=”#333333″ text_font_size=”14px” text_font_size_tablet=”” text_font_size_phone=”12px” text_font_size_last_edited=”on|tablet”]— NZ male, 24 yrs (46)[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built=”1″ custom_padding_last_edited=”on|desktop” _builder_version=”3.22″ custom_padding=”0px|0px|0px|0px” custom_padding_tablet=”” custom_padding_phone=””][et_pb_row use_custom_gutter=”on” gutter_width=”1″ _builder_version=”4.9.4″ use_background_color_gradient=”on” background_color_gradient_start=”#efefef” background_color_gradient_end=”rgba(0,0,0,0)” background_color_gradient_end_position=”30%” background_color_gradient_overlays_image=”on” background_image=”http://thelightproject.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/great-sex-footer.jpg” width=”100%” width_tablet=”100%” width_phone=”” width_last_edited=”on|desktop” max_width=”100%” max_width_tablet=”100%” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” height_tablet=”500px” height_phone=”500px” height_last_edited=”on|phone” make_fullwidth=”on”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_divider show_divider=”off” _builder_version=”4.9.4″ height=”800px” height_tablet=”300px” height_phone=”200px” height_last_edited=”on|phone” max_height_tablet=”300px” max_height_phone=”200px” max_height_last_edited=”on|desktop”]  [/et_pb_divider][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]

excerpt.rendered: So what’s the difference between great sex and porn sex?We all want great sex and we know that consent, emotional connection, pleasure and feeling safe are a key part of this. So how do they compare…?“I definitely think it’s a good thing realising that sex and real life is different from porn – you kinda […]
